column4: I do not understand. I thought Ubuntu was much more mainstream than this.
install imagemagick, then run: convert <file.gif> <file.png>
Why?
converts the file to something ubuntu definately can use. Im unsure of gif support for wallpaper
use opera
it helps if you remove java plugins and install 64bit flash
What?
The goal of endusers is to USE internet.
yuo can, in my experience java makes 64bit browsers a bit flaky
Good for you for finding a great OS and a great BROWSER. Really. In this time of year everyone deserves to be satisfied and happy. Good for you.
installing 64bit flash on a 64bit system rather than 32bit on 64bit hardware can help too
ive no idea what you mean or what your point is
Exactly.
all i can do is advise based on personal experience so lose the attitude
ive had forefox flakey as hell, after pulling java out which I rarely use ever it was a hell load better
Agreed. I DO lose the attitude and lose Ubuntu when browsing internet. Flash exists. Deal with it.
you could also try apt-building it, its made my firefox significantly slicker
you didnt read what I said. Install the 64bit release from www.adobe.com will give you 64bit flash
I have done that. Please do that yourself. It simply does not work (capitalize that).
if you remove the 32bit version and no doubt nspluginwrapper
and use that, you'll have nice flash runing properly
Ok. I realize you are trying to help, but no. No. No. I have tried that for months ( capitalizes that ).
tried what?
